result.execSummary:
The defendant Collin Dale Lambert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.20-.249)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: * August 23, 2022/Judge Danielle Shelton: Court ordered that the Judgment of Conviction shall be amended to include the enhancer under Wis. Stat. Section 346.65(2)(g)2.*

miscConds.notes: The Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $1800 plus applicable costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Cash bail on deposit is to be applied.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fines, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court DOES NOT allow good time credit.

records.addlTxt:
CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 45. 
Defendant Collin Dale Lambert in court with Attorney Sarah Zwach.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by the State, Defense Counsel and Defendant.  Additional statement by: Lori L. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS with2 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED:
- 10 MONTHS of condition time at the House of Correction with Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court DOES NOT allow good time credit.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Operating privileges suspended for a period of 2 YEARS. 
- Ignition interlock for a period of 2 YEARS.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
- 120 hours of community service at a non-profit organization. 

The Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $1800 plus applicable costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Cash bail on deposit is to be applied.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fines, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.  Firearm and voting warnings given.

Defendant Collin Dale Lambert in court with Attorney Sarah Zwach.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing.  


AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 45.

The Court order the matter adjourned.  Branch 40 and will conduct the Sentencing hearing for Branch 45.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Collin Dale Lambert in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Collin Dale Lambert in custody.  Kaitlyn Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Collin Dale Lambert appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY. Defendant was ordered to appear for all court appearances with or without an attorney.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
